Life o' Garlynn Woodsong

properties.description: Posted by Garlynnamsterdam, netherlandsWhere I stayed for two... or was it three nights? Great bicycling and stuff. Especially coffeehouses.

properties.description: Posted by GarlynnGenoa, ItalyI spent a night here in the summer of 1996... incidentally, this is the city where Christopher Columbus hailed from. Great seafood, nice walkable central city, charming overall...

properties.description: Posted by Garlynngerlach, nv...more precisely, this is about where the Green Gorilla Lounge set up camp in 2005. :-)

properties.description: Posted by Garlynn2033 Nw Glisan St, Portland, ORAttended from 5th grade through 10th grade... went to college for two years... received high school diploma with my class, june 1997.

properties.name: Mexcaltitán, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnMexcaltitán, mexicoThis is supposedly the ancestral home of the Aztecs. I stayed here in 2003... beautiful little car-free island village, only accessible by lancha.

properties.name: Montreal!
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnWas in Montreal for Spring Break 1996, loved the old French Quarter, the subway/buses, the downtown, the restaurants... great city!! Friendly people, too.

properties.name: Mulege, Mexico (Playa de Coyote)
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnmulege, mexicoStayed here for a little while during the 2002-2003 xmas/new year\'s trip, on the beach!! Glowing night-time ocean organisms, anyone?

properties.description: Posted by GarlynnPortland, OR

properties.name: Papantla, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnpapantla, mexicoMom and I also stayed here for a little while during our xmas vacation from Chihuahua, 1996. Nice little small town, not so far from the beach by local bus...

properties.name: Paris, France
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnparis, franceI stayed somewhere in this city for a couple of nights during the summer of 1996.

properties.name: Perula, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnI think we stayed at the Hotel Playa Dorada here, but my memory is a bit fuzzy on this one...

properties.name: Petershagen, Germany
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnpetershagen, germany...where I stayed with Mike Kurth for 3 weeks in the summer of 1996

properties.name: Pisa, Italy
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnpisa, italyI stayed a block from the leaning tower for a night, in a hotel with an attached bath with a bidet, for 0 a night! Summer of 1996....

properties.name: Portland Office of Transportation
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1120 SW 5th ave, portland, orDid GIS/Engineering in the Street Systems Section of the Portland Office of Transportation, in the Portland Building, just behind Portlandia!!

properties.name: Quebec City, Quebec
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnquebec city, quebecNorth America\'s only remaining walled city, whose walls were built to protect it against an American invasion. I visited here during Spring Break 1996... and it snowed. :-) Great place, good beer, good wine, good food... friendly people!

properties.name: Saddle Mountain
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnThis is Saddle Mountain. As the website says, it\'s only 2. 5 miles to the top... ...but you\'d better be prepared. It\'s a very diverse two miles. And steep. And dangerous in parts. But from the top, on a clear day, you can see for hundreds of miles... to Mt. Hood and many of the other peaks of the Cascades, up and down the Coast Range, out to sea... it\'s an amazing view. Sunsets are spectacular from up there. But don\'t forget to bring some flashlights for the way back down if you don\'t intend to spend the night!

properties.name: Salamanca, Spain
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnsalamanca, spainWhere I lived for a month during the summer of 1996, studying espanish ;-)

properties.name: Secret Kansas Street Pedestrian Path
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnMost people think that Kansas Street does not go through. Including many people who actually live on Kansas Street. However, this is simply not the case. If you\'re a pedestrian, or a bicylist willing to heft your bike on your shoulder, it does, in fact, go through. And this is where. Just keep going. From the bottom, look for the little dirt staircase to your right. From the top -- that fence is an optical illusion, you can actually walk right through it, and there\'s a little concrete staircase going down in the middle.

properties.name: Shady Cove, OR
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn  Shady Cove, ORMy family\'s land, and the surrounding Rogue River Valley

properties.name: Simon's Rock College of Bard
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 84 alford road, great barrington, ma

properties.name: Some beach east of San Jose del Cabo, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn  san jose del cabo, mexicoWe stayed here for Xmas 2003 on the beach. Or, at least, at some beach out on this road about 10 miles past san jose del cabo...

properties.name: Sonoma Technology, Inc.
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1360 redwood way, petaluma, caWorked with GIS and Air Quality in year 2000.

properties.name: St Viateur Bagel Shop
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 263 St-Viateur Street West, Montreal, QCRumored to have the best bagels in the world. Me and my Jewish friend from New Jersey both agreed that, indeed, we had never tasted finer bagels anywhere else. And he\'s a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America, a bona-fide chef. But don\'t take our word for it. Skeptical? Go to Montreal. Go to this bagel shop. Get a dozen bagels (yeah, just try deciding on one). Eat them. Comment below. ;-)

properties.name: Sublounge (R.I.P.)
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnFor a few years, this was the best little DJ Bar, best Burning Man Bar, and best small nightclub in San Francisco, according to SF Weekly polls. Owned by burners, by members of the Spacelounge theme camp, by cool folks. Unfortunately, its very underground-ness, and off-the-beaten-path-ness, was what did it in. Not enough daily food traffic, and not enough promotion, put it out of business.

properties.name: Tampico, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnTampico, MexicoMy Mom and I stayed here during our Xmas vacation in 1986.

properties.name: The Ghetto Vic
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn94110In San Francisco\'s Potrero Slope/Mission District, Near General Hospital.

properties.name: The Marine Mammal Center
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnTreatment center for marine mammals -- primarily elephant seals, sea lions and harbor seals, but other as well.

properties.name: Top of Mt. Tamalpais -- East Peak
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnThis is the "top" of Mt. Tam, for the purposes of hiking to the top to get the best view. Mt. Tam is more of a ridge than a mountain, but as such, this is the top.

properties.name: Tri-Met Capital Projects Office
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1110 ne holladay st, portland, orInterned with the Tri-Met Westside Light Rail Office, 1997-1998

properties.name: Venice, Italy
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnMy favorite city in Italy -- car-free Venice!!

properties.name: Veracruz, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnVeracruz, MexicoMy Mom and I stayed here in 1986 during our Xmas vacation from Chihuahua. I think she had to pawn her camera for us to get the cash to continue the vacation, until our wire transfer came in from the states. We were here for a while, eating oysters and crackers, hot dogs, corn on a stick....

properties.name: Vermont St- The Other Curviest Street In The World
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnSure, a lot of people think that Lombard St is the curviest in the world, but Vermont St in Potrero Hill is, at the very least, just as curvy. With fewer tourists.

properties.name: Verona, Italy
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnVerona, ItalyI stayed here, in the city of Romeo and Juliet, in the summer of 1996. Charming little northern Italian hill-town. You can still go see Juliet\'s balcony. Romeo\'s house, however, is not so accessible.

properties.name: Yelapa, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnpuerto vallarta, mexicoAccessible by about an hour-long lancha ride from the docks south of Puerto Vallarta, themselves reachable by city bus from the center of the city, Yelapa offers a beautiful car-free village in the middle of the jungle, with some nice waterfalls within day-hiking distance. We stayed here in 2003, in a palapa off the beach.

properties.name: Zurich, Switzerland
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnzurich, switzerlandI stayed here for a couple of nights in the summer of 1996, and took a day-long self-guided train tour of the country in between.
